info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 11:57PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Schoharie and southwestern Montgomery Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1156 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Jordanville to near Middlefield to near Cooperstown Junction. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cobleskill, Canajoharie, Summit, Schoharie, Richmondville, Sharon Springs, Ames, Breakabeen, Central Bridge, Carlisle, Sharon, Seward, Zeh Corners, Beekman Corners, West Richmondville, Baird Corners, Warnerville, Flat Creek, Engleville and Gardnersville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 22. Interstate 90 near exit 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EDT for eastern New York.
